te: ఈ ఊళ్ళో కూడా ఆయనకు ఒక ఇల్లు ఉంది.
en: He has a house in this town also.
hi: इस शहर में भी उनके पास एक घर है।

en: How many houses does he have?
So, he has houses in two places?
hi: उनके पास दो शहरों में घर हैं क्या?

en: How many children does he have?
Narayana is Venkateswarlu’s younger brother, isn’t he?
hi: नारायण वॆंकटेश्वर्लु का छोटा भाई है ना?

en: How many children does he have?
Are they grown up or young?
All of them are grown up.
How many of them are girls?
How many of them are boys?

hi: दो लड़कियाँ हैं और दो लड़के हैं।

te: ఆమెకు ఒక ఆడపిల్లా, ఒక మగ పిల్లవాడూ.
en: She has a daughter and a son.
hi: उसकी एक बेटी है और एक बेटा है।

en: The younger daughter is 25 years old.
The elder son is 28 years old.
But he does not have a job.
The eldest daughter is a writer, isn’t she?
hi: बड़ी बेटी लेखक है, है ना?

en: She is one of the top writers in Telugu.
hi: तॆलुगु में बड़े लेखकों में एक है।

en: She is a very good woman.
He is also a very good man.
He is also a good man.

hi: उनके बच्चे भी अच्छे ही हैं।

en: How many marks did you get in Telugu?
hi: तुम्हें तॆलुगु में कितने marks मिले?

en: How many marks did you get in mathematics?
hi: आपको गणित में कितने marks मिले?

en: I too have no sisters, sir!
I don’t have elder sisters, sir.
One is not here at present.
hi: एक बहन अभी यहाँ नहीं है।

en: She is at my uncle’s house in Vijayawada.
hi: विजयवाड़ा में मेरे चाचा/मौसा के घर पर है।
आपके चाचाजी/मौसाजी के बच्चे नहीं हैं क्या?

te: అయితే మీ బాబాయిగారికి కొడుకులు ఉన్నారు కాని కూతుళ్ళు లేరన్నమాట!
en: Then, your uncle has sons and not daughters!
hi: तो फिर आपके चाचाजी/मौसाजी के बेटे हैं पर बेटियाँ नहीं हैं।

en: in the town (locative form of ఊరు)
father’s younger brother; mother’s younger sister’s husband
in the house (locative case form of ఇల్లు)
